abstract: Crucell, the Dutch biotechnology firm, said Monday that Johnson & Johnson had bought 14.6 million new Crucell shares for $443.5 million as part of a flu vaccine development deal.
snippet: Crucell, the Dutch biotechnology firm, said Monday that Johnson & Johnson had bought 14.6 million new Crucell shares for $443.5 million as part of a flu vaccine development deal.
lead_paragraph: Dutch biotechnology firm Crucell said on Monday Johnson & Johnson had bought 14.6 million new Crucell shares for 302 million euros ($443.5 million) as part of a flu vaccine development deal.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Invests $444 Million in Crucell
